verses.verse: Then again <WH3254> Abraham <WH85> took <WH3947> a wife <WH802>, and her name <WH8034> was Keturah <WH6989>.
And she bore <WH3205> him Zimran <WH2175>, and Jokshan <WH3370>, and Medan <WH4091>, and Midian <WH4080>, and Ishbak <WH3435>, and Shuah <WH7744>.
And Jokshan <WH3370> fathered <WH3205> Sheba <WH7614>, and Dedan <WH1719>. And the sons <WH1121> of Dedan <WH1719> were Asshurim <WH805>, and Letushim <WH3912>, and Leummim <WH3817>.
And the sons <WH1121> of Midian <WH4080>; Ephah <WH5891>, and Epher <WH6081>, and Hanoch <WH2585>, and Abida <WH28>, and Eldaah <WH420>. All these were the children <WH1121> of Keturah <WH6989>.
And Abraham <WH85> gave <WH5414> all that he had unto Isaac <WH3327>.

But unto the sons <WH1121> of the concubines <WH6370>, which Abraham <WH85> had <WH85>, Abraham gave <WH5414> gifts <WH4979>, and sent them away <WH7971> from Isaac <WH3327> his son <WH1121>, while he yet lived <WH2416>, eastward <WH6924>, unto the east <WH6924> country <WH776>.
And these are the days <WH3117> of the years <WH8141> of Abraham <WH85>'s life <WH2416> which he lived <WH2425>, an hundred <WH3967> sixty and fifteen <WH7657> years <WH8141>.

Then Abraham <WH85> gave up the ghost <WH1478>, and died <WH4191> in a good <WH2896> old age <WH7872>, an old man <WH2205>, and full <WH7649> of years <WH622>; and was gathered to his people <WH5971>.

And his sons <WH1121> Isaac <WH3327> and Ishmael <WH3458> buried <WH6912> him in the cave <WH4631> of Machpelah <WH4375>, in the field <WH7704> of Ephron <WH6085> the son <WH1121> of Zohar <WH6714> the Hittite <WH2850>, which is before <WH6440> Mamre <WH4471>;
The field <WH7704> which Abraham <WH85> purchased <WH7069> of the sons <WH1121> of Heth <WH2845>: there was Abraham <WH85> buried <WH6912>, and Sarah <WH8283> his wife <WH802>.

And it came to pass after <WH310> the death <WH4194> of Abraham <WH85>, that God <WH430> blessed <WH1288> his son <WH1121> Isaac <WH3327>; and Isaac <WH3327> lived <WH3427> by <WH5973> the well Lahai <WH883>–roi.

Now these are the generations <WH8435> of Ishmael <WH3458>, Abraham <WH85>'s son <WH1121>, whom Hagar <WH1904> the Egyptian <WH4713>, Sarah <WH8283>'s handmaid <WH8198>, gave birth <WH3205> unto Abraham <WH85>:

And these are the names <WH8034> of the sons <WH1121> of Ishmael <WH3458>, by their names <WH8034>, according to their generations <WH8435>: the firstborn <WH1060> of Ishmael <WH3458>, Nebajoth <WH5032>; and Kedar <WH6938>, and Adbeel <WH110>, and Mibsam <WH4017>,
And Mishma <WH4927>, and Dumah <WH1746>, and Massa <WH4854>,
Hadar <WH2316>, and Tema <WH8485>, Jetur <WH3195>, Naphish <WH5305>, and Kedemah <WH6929>:

These are the sons <WH1121> of Ishmael <WH3458>, and these are their names <WH8034>, by their towns <WH2691>, and by their castles <WH2918>; twelve <WH8147> princes <WH5387> according to their nations <WH523>.

And these are the years <WH8141> of the life <WH2416> of Ishmael <WH3458>, an hundred <WH3967> and thirty <WH7970> and seven <WH7651> years <WH8141>: and he gave up the ghost <WH1478> and died <WH4191>; and was gathered <WH622> unto his people <WH5971>.

And they lived <WH7931> from Havilah <WH2341> unto Shur <WH7793>, that is before <WH6440> Egypt <WH4714>, as you go <WH935> toward Assyria <WH804>: and he died <WH5307> in the presence <WH6440> of all his brothers <WH251>.
And these are the generations <WH8435> of Isaac <WH3327>, Abraham <WH85>'s son <WH1121>: Abraham <WH85> fathered <WH3205> Isaac <WH3327>:

And Isaac <WH3327> was forty <WH705> years <WH8141> old <WH1121> when he took <WH3947> Rebekah <WH7259> to wife <WH802>, the daughter <WH1323> of Bethuel <WH1328> the Syrian <WH761> of Padan <WH6307>–aram, the sister <WH269> to Laban <WH3837> the Syrian <WH761>.

And Isaac <WH3327> entreated <WH6279> the Lord <WH3068> for <WH5227> his wife <WH802>, because she was childless <WH6135>: and the Lord <WH3068> was entreated <WH6279> of him <WH7259>, and Rebekah his wife <WH802> conceived <WH2029>.
And the children <WH1121> struggled together <WH7533> within her <WH7130>; and she said <WH559>, If it be so <WH2088>, why am I thus? And she went <WH3212> to inquire <WH1875> of the Lord <WH3068>.

And the Lord <WH3068> said <WH559> unto her <WH8147>, Two nations <WH1471> are in your womb <WH990>, and two manner <WH8147> of people <WH3816> shall be separated <WH6504> from your body <WH4578>; and the one people <WH3816> shall be stronger <WH553> than the other people <WH3816>; and the elder <WH7227> shall serve <WH5647> the younger <WH6810>.
And when her days <WH3117> to be delivered <WH3205> were fulfilled <WH4390>, behold <WH8380>, there were twins in her womb <WH990>.
And the first <WH7223> came out <WH3318> red <WH132>, all over like an hairy <WH8181> garment <WH155>; and they called <WH7121> his name <WH8034> Esau <WH6215>.

And after <WH310> that came <WH3318> his brother <WH251> out <WH3318>, and his hand <WH3027> took hold <WH270> on Esau <WH6215>'s heel <WH6119>; and his name <WH8034> was called <WH7121> Jacob <WH3290>: and Isaac <WH3327> was sixty <WH8346> years <WH8141> old <WH1121> when she gave birth to them <WH3205>.

And the boys <WH5288> grew <WH1431>: and Esau <WH6215> was a cunning <WH3045> hunter <WH6718>, a man <WH376> of the field <WH7704>; and Jacob <WH3290> was a plain <WH8535> man <WH376>, living <WH3427> in tents <WH168>.
And Isaac <WH3327> loved <WH157> Esau <WH6215>, because he did eat <WH6310> of his venison <WH6718>: but Rebekah <WH7259> loved <WH157> Jacob <WH3290>.
And Jacob <WH3290> boiled <WH2102> stew <WH5138>: and Esau <WH6215> came <WH935> from the field <WH7704>, and he was faint <WH5889>:

And Esau <WH6215> said <WH559> to Jacob <WH3290>, Feed <WH3938> me <WH4480>, I pray you with that same <WH122> red <WH122> stew for I am faint <WH5889>: therefore was his name <WH8034> called <WH7121> Edom <WH123>.
And Jacob <WH3290> said <WH559>, Sell <WH4376> me this day <WH3117> your birthright <WH1062>.
And Esau <WH6215> said <WH559>, Behold <WH1980>, I am at the point to die <WH4191>: and what profit shall this birthright do to me <WH1062>?
And Jacob <WH3290> said <WH559>, Swear <WH7650> to me this day <WH3117>; and he swore <WH7650> unto him <WH4376>: and he sold his birthright <WH1062> unto Jacob <WH3290>.

Then Jacob <WH3290> gave <WH5414> Esau <WH6215> bread <WH3899> and stew <WH5138> of lentils <WH5742>; and he did eat <WH398> and drink <WH8354>, and rose up <WH6965>, and went his way <WH3212>: thus Esau <WH6215> despised <WH959> his birthright <WH1062>.
